name: For 'Blues Brothers' Diehards, Part 3 Quiz | Movies | 15 Questions

questions.text: After barging into the upscale French restaurant where Mr. Fabulous (Alan Rubin) works, how many orders of shrimp cocktail does Jake Blues (John Belushi) ask the waiter to bring him?
questions.explanation:
five & 5.

	He also asks for some bread for Elwood.

questions.text: Jake also orders a bottle of Dom Perignon. What year is the vintage?
When Jake and Elwood (Dan Aykroyd) are discussing substandard prison food with Matt 'Guitar' Murphy, which of the following dishes is NOT mentioned?
questions.explanation:
chipped beef.

	Jake says, of the Joliet Correctional Facility, 'On Thursday nights they serve a wicked pepper steak.' Matt: 'Can't be as bad as the cabbage rolls in the Terre Haute federal pen.' Elwood: 'Or that oatmeal at the Cook County slammer.'

questions.text: What's the name of the beauty salon where Camille (Carrie Fisher) works?
questions.explanation:
Curl Up and Dye.

	We see her inside the establishment after hours, browsing weaponry manuals. Perhaps she owns the place?

questions.text: We see Camille leafing through an instructional manual for a flame-thrower. What is its designation?
questions.explanation:
M-79.

	'M-79 Flame-thrower' is clearly visible on the cover of the manual.

questions.text: The entire band does some serious browsing once they arrive at Ray's Music Exchange, the music store (and pawn shop) owned by the titular Ray (Ray Charles). What item does Elwood seem particularly interested in?
questions.explanation:
a toaster oven.

	Elwood even takes some white bread out of his inside jacket pocket (don't ask) and places it in the toaster oven, presumably to test out its spatial parameters.

questions.text: During the scene at Ray's Music Exchange, Ray does something that a blind man should not be able to do. What is it?
questions.correct: He fires a handgun with remarkable accuracy
options: He catches a drumstick that has been thrown to him
questions.explanation:
He fires a handgun with remarkable accuracy.

	Ray is somehow able to sense that a young boy is preparing to steal a guitar mounted on the wall. He then draws a pistol and fires a couple of rounds into the wall just inches from the boy's wandering hand.  Ray Charles IS Daredevil!

questions.text: A number of popular dances are mentioned during Ray's rendition of 'Shake Your Tailfeather.' Which of the following is NOT one of them?
questions.explanation:
the bossa nova.

	A crowd of talented dancers gathers outside Ray's shop and performs every dance that he mentions...but the bossa nova is not one of them.

questions.text: At one point, Jake and Elwood share a phone booth that is launched into the air thanks to an explosion. What restaurant is in the background when this happens?
questions.explanation:
Howard Johnson's.

	Camille uses her flame-thrower to ignite a propane tank sitting right next to the phone booth. A Howard Johnson's is clearly visible in the background.

questions.text: Once the phone booth crash-lands on terra firma (leaving Jake and Elwood miraculously unharmed, of course), the change container of the pay phone cracks wide open and spills coins all over the ground. Finish Elwood's line as he notices this windfall: 'There must be __________ dollars worth of change here!'
questions.explanation:
seven & 7.

	You know, considering the Penguin's apparent telekinetic abilities, Ray's hyper-senses, and Jake and Elwood's invulnerability, I'm wondering if 'The Blues Brothers' is in fact a science fiction film. =)

questions.text: In order to convince the band that they do have a gig, Jake decides to impersonate the leader of a band called The Good Ole Boys. He then asks the waitress at the club what kind of music is generally played in that venue. Finish her sentence: 'Oh, we got both kinds -- ____________________________.'
questions.explanation:
country and western.

	If there is a Hell, and I wind up there, these will doubtless be the words that I will hear upon my arrival, I feel sure.

questions.text: Which member of the band notices aloud that the stage at their first gig is encased in chicken wire?
questions.explanation:
'Blue' Lou Marini.

	Marini, obviously a graduate of the Strasberg school, mutters, 'Chicken wire?' as the band approaches the stage for the first time.

questions.text: When the band begins to play their regular set, the audience expresses violent disapproval. What, in fact, is the first song that they try to play before realizing that their usual fare won't fly with the crowd?
questions.explanation:
'Gimme Some Lovin'.

	The band only gets about 45 seconds into 'Gimme Some Lovin' before the barrage of beer bottles and the din of disgusted screaming and booing convinces the boys to try a different strategy.

questions.text: In what key does the band play the theme from 'Rawhide'?
questions.explanation:
A.

	Donald 'Duck' Dunn points out that A is a 'good country key.' Elwood shrugs and responds with, 'Rawhide' in A.'

questions.text: After playing the 'Rawhide' theme, the band goes into another song, a cover, that is equally well-received by the crowd. Who originally performed this second song?
questions.explanation:
Tammy Wynette.

	It still amuses me when I see Jake and Elwood singing 'Stand By Your Man' with such conviction. More 'Blues Brothers' trivia to come, so don't touch that dial!
